title: Where we can't use articles? - Quora

response.answer_text: O.P: Where can we not use articles? The ZERO article usually occurs in the following cases: Where is John? [ with proper names]He studies in Oxford University. [with names of institutions]Wall Street is the financial center of the United States. [ with names of places]I am going to have breakfast. [ with meals]The breakfast that we had yesterday was fabulous. [If there is an adjective before the name of the meal or a phrase or clause after it, an article is used.]I will come on Monday. [ with names of days]I will come in March. [ With names of months]I will come in winter. [ with seasons]I am coming at Christmas. [ with holidays]I will teach you after sun set. [ With certain parts of the day (with the exception of in “the” morning/afternoon/evening)]I met him on the Sunday of that week. [If there is an adjective before the noun or a phrase or clause after it [Valid for 6,7,8,9], the noun usually takes an article.]I met him at Mughal’s dinner. [Names of pubs, restaurants etc. that use the possessive “ 's “ construction]I love soccer. [with names of sports, games and activities]Australia, North America,etc [with names of continents; exceptions: The Americas, The Antarctic and The Arctic]India, Pakistan, etc. [ with names of countries; exceptions: The United Kingdom, The USA, The Netherlands and The Philippines]Lake Victoria, Lake Geneva, etc. [ with names of lakes]Mount Everest, Mount Kenya, etc [ with names of mountain peaks; exceptions: The Matterhorn]Delhi, Mumbai, etc [ with cities; exceptions: The Vatican and The Hague]What beautiful weather! [in exclamations with “what plus an uncountable noun”]By car, on time, etc. [ With Certain prepositional phrases ]We drove in a black car. [If there is a word or phrase that modifies the noun, an article is used[Valid for 20]Students are going to school. [With certain places and institutions when we are talking about “the purpose they are used for” otherwise “the” is used: I am going to the school to pick up my son.]Thanks.

We don’t use articles with proper nouns or names:Incorrect: The Mike lives in Bangalore, India. Correct: Mike lives in Bangalore, India. Articles are not used with material nouns. Examples are: gold, silver, iron, wheat, rice etc.Incorrect: The gold is yellow. Correct: Gold is yellow. Other examples:Incorrect: I have an urgent business. Correct: I have urgent business. OR I have some urgent business. Incorrect: I have a great news for you. Correct: I have great news for you. Hope it answers your question! Cheers!
